Abstract: Automated waste sorting system using computer vision to identify and categorize recyclables in real-time
Team: Maria Chen; Jonas Weber; Aisha Patel
Situation: Manual waste sorting is slow and error-prone with contamination rates of 15-20% leading to rejected recycling batches
ProblemStatement: How might we reduce contamination in recycling streams while increasing sorting speed?
Inspiration: Amazon warehouse robotics; Tesla Optimus object recognition; Municipal sorting facilities in Japan
Concept: Camera-equipped sorting station that identifies waste items and directs them to correct bins via air jets
Technology: Computer Vision; TensorFlow; Raspberry Pi; Pneumatic actuators; Python
Experience: Workers see real-time classification on screen with confidence scores and can override incorrect sorts
Business: Reduces labor costs by 40% and contamination rates to under 3%
Learnings: Edge deployment requires careful model optimization; lighting conditions critical for accuracy

Abstract: Hands-free documentation system for surgeons using speech recognition and medical NLP
Team: Dr. Felix Hoffmann; Sarah Kim; Raj Gupta
Situation: Surgeons spend 2+ hours daily on post-operative documentation taking time away from patient care
ProblemStatement: How might we reduce documentation burden while improving accuracy and completeness of medical records?
Inspiration: Dragon Medical; ambient computing research; OpenAI Whisper
Concept: Voice-activated system that listens during procedures and auto-generates structured reports
Technology: Whisper ASR; Medical NER; FHIR integration; React Native; Azure
Experience: Surgeon speaks naturally during procedure; reviews and approves generated report in under 5 minutes
Business: Saves 90 minutes per surgeon per day; estimated value of €150k annually per surgeon
Learnings: Medical terminology requires domain-specific fine-tuning; privacy concerns require on-premise deployment

Abstract: IoT sensor network for predictive maintenance in agricultural equipment
Team: Tom Anderson; Liu Wei; Emma Schulz
Situation: Farmers lose critical harvest time when equipment fails unexpectedly in the field
ProblemStatement: How might we predict equipment failures before they happen to minimize downtime during peak seasons?
Inspiration: Predictive maintenance in aviation; John Deere connectivity; Bosch IoT solutions
Concept: Retrofit sensor kit that monitors vibration and temperature patterns to predict component failures
Technology: LoRaWAN; Vibration sensors; Temperature probes; AWS IoT; Machine Learning
Experience: Farmer receives mobile alerts 48-72 hours before likely failure with recommended actions
Business: Prevents average €25k loss per avoided breakdown; subscription model €99/month per vehicle
Learnings: Battery life in remote areas challenging; farmer trust requires explainable predictions

Abstract: Smart retail display that adapts content based on customer emotion and engagement
Team: Nina Kowalski; James O'Brien; Yuki Tanaka
Situation: Static digital signage has low engagement rates averaging 2-3 seconds of attention
ProblemStatement: How might we create dynamic retail experiences that respond to individual customer interest?
Inspiration: Minority Report advertising; Spotify mood playlists; interactive museum exhibits
Concept: Display screen with embedded camera that detects attention and emotional response to adjust content
Technology: Emotion AI; OpenCV; Dynamic content engine; Digital signage CMS; Edge computing
Experience: Customer glances at display; content shifts to match detected interest; engagement extends naturally
Business: Increases engagement time by 340% and conversion rate by 12% in pilot stores
Learnings: Privacy communication essential; opt-out mechanism required; lighting affects emotion detection

Abstract: AI-powered contract analysis tool that identifies risks and non-standard clauses
Team: Anna Bergström; Michael Torres; Priya Sharma
Situation: Legal teams spend 3-4 hours reviewing each vendor contract for risks and deviations from standards
ProblemStatement: How might we accelerate contract review while ensuring no critical risks are missed?
Inspiration: Kira Systems; Legal AI research; GPT-4 contract experiments
Concept: Upload-and-analyze system that highlights risky clauses and compares against company playbook
Technology: LLM fine-tuning; RAG architecture; Document parsing; React frontend; PostgreSQL
Experience: User uploads contract and receives annotated PDF with risk scores and suggested amendments in minutes
Business: Reduces review time by 70%; enables legal team to handle 3x contract volume
Learnings: Hallucination risk requires human-in-the-loop; training data from actual contracts essential
